dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so you know, I saw this headline the other day about Chris Hemsworth wearing, like, a 70-pound fat suit for Thor. And I just thought, "Man, the things these guys do for their art!"

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Yeah, totally! But, you know, speaking of things these big Hollywood guys are doing, uh, the real story right now is actually what's happening to their *wallets*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally! But, you know, speaking of things these big Hollywood guys are doing, uh, the real story right now is actually what's happening to their wallets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh? Is the golden age of the big-budget star, like, over? I thought guys like Leo were still crushing it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh? Is the golden age of the big-budget star, like, over? I thought guys like Leo were still crushing it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they are, but for most, it's getting, um, a lot tougher. Hollywood's kinda losing its big-money brands, and audiences are shifting. Actors are being forced into these weird deals now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they are, but for most, it's getting, um, a lot tougher. Hollywood's kinda losing its big-money brands, and audiences are shifting. Actors are being forced into these weird deals now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the lucrative twenty-twenty deal ($20 million upfront and 20% of gross profit) doled out to the likes of Harrison Ford and Tom Cruise may be more or less gone, Hollywood still has its big-money brands, those actors who can promise an audience so big that they command not only an eight-figure salary to show up on set but also a decent chunk of a films nebulous pool...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Like what? I heard something about The Rock, Dwayne Johnson, having a tough time. He was, like, the highest-paid, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Like what? I heard something about The Rock, Dwayne Johnson, having a tough time. He was, like, the highest-paid, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Dwayne Johnson, also known as the Rock, tops the Forbes list of the worlds ten highest-paid actors, collecting $89.4 million between June 1, 2018, and June 1, 2019.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He *was* number one! Made almost 90 million between 2018 and 2019. But now, he's actually fallen from that top spot. He even said in 2018, "What will destroy our careers... what will bankrupt us?"

It has to be audience first. What does the audience want, and what is the best scenario that we can create that will send them home happy? Johnson told Forbes in 2018.

dialogue_turns.text: Wait, he *pays* money for *Ballers*? That's wild. So even the biggest action stars are feeling the pinch.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. Even Robert Downey Jr. For *Avengers: Endgame*, which grossed almost $2.8 billion, he got $20 million upfront and 8% of the pool. Sounds huge, right? But it ended up being "only" $55 million.

dialogue_turns.text: "Only" $55 million. [laughs] That's Hollywood math for ya.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only fifty five million dollars. That's Hollywood math for ya.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And then there's Bradley Cooper. His *A Star Is Born* was a massive hit, but he ended up owing, like, an estimated $40 million because of how the deal was structured.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It paid offthe movie, which had a production budget of only $36 million, grossed $435 million worldwide, leaving Cooper with an estimated $40 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's nuts! So a huge success can actually cost you? How does that even make sense?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's nuts! So a huge success can actually cost you? How does that even make sense?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's all about who takes what percentage and when. He directed, produced, co-wrote, starred... so he had a lot of skin in the game. But, funnily enough, voicing Rocket Raccoon actually saved his ranking, because that was a much simpler, guaranteed payday.
